Authors:
Chiharu Nakashima, Yukako Hattori, Keiichi Motohashi, Ayaka
Hieno
Title:
Detection of Colletotrichum gloeosporioides species complex
using a loop-mediated isothermal amplification assay
Abstract:
The Colletotrichum gloeosporioides species complex is
known as causal plant pathogens of Anthracnose diseases of various
crops. In this study, to rapidly detect the causal fungi of anthracnose
diseases from the cultivating period to the market after the harvesting,
we designated a loop-mediated isothermal amplification assay (LAMP)
primer set based on the calmodulin gene coded region sequences from
taxonomically authorized isolates of this species complex. Moreover, the
specificity and detectable range of the set were examined with isolates
selected from various species complex of the genus Colletotrichum to
evaluate its specificity and its detectable range. The LAMP primer set
specifically detected the Colletotrichum gloeosporioides species
complex, including Colletotrichum gloeosporioides, C. aotearoa, C.
fructicola, C. horii, C. kahawae, C. musae, C. siamense, C.
theobromicola, and C. tropicale.
